author: butek
msg: I've discovered a JDK 1.3 implementation for our ImageIO plugin.  The
problem is, it can only write JPEG format, and it's depends on
sun.awt.image.codec.JPEGImageEncoderImpl, though the Sun, the IBM,
and the HP JDKs all have this class.
I've added this class so that those who want to use a non-JIMI JDK1.3
implementation have something they can use, even if it's as limited as this

author: gdaniels
msg: Preserve attributes for streaming and attachment type when writing

author: butek
msg: javaType and xmlType could, indeed be null (and they are in one of the TCK tests).

author: butek
msg: Attachment support works up to the point of the TCK.  It has been tested
somewhat beyond the TCK (see tests/wsdl/attachments) but not very far.
In this final commit I've changed the MIME logic significantly.  Since we've
created AXIS-specific MIME types I was able to create (de)serializers for
these types.  This eliminated a lot of the ugly MIME logic in the code.

author: rubys
msg: Apparently one can't rely on messages having context (faults apparently
